intro: Euphrona ternata, commonly known as the three-lobed euphrona, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
